snippet: It sure seems as though the American leaker is now the most popular man in China.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column recounts conversations with Chinese officials after news broke concerning fugitive contractor Edward Snowden; holds China seized upon Snowden's revelation that United States has routinely hacked into Chinese computers, undercutting Obama administration's criticism of Chinese cyberespionage; holds that such hypocrisy has become trademark of United States foreign policy.
lead_paragraph: It sure seems as though the American leaker is now the most popular man in China.

headline.print_headline: This Isn’t How to Stop Hacking
